content: spring vibes clutch bag by jennifer dickinson transform any flat zipper pouch into a joyful accessory with any yarn you choose finished size fits any sized flat zipper pouch difficulty easy hook choose the hook that best suits your yarn yarn any yarn will work additional materials zipper pouch scissors yarn needle sewing needle and thread abbreviations american terms chain chain single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch decrease single_crochet 2 together insert hook into stitch and pull up a loop insert hook into next stitch and pull up a loop yarn over and pull through all three loops on hook * … * repeat instructions between the stars instructions make a starting chain as long as the base of your bag then add two more chain stitches the loop on your hook doesn t count as a chain skip one chain then single_crochet into the bump on the back of the chain place stitch marker into that stitch single_crochet in the bumps to the end of the row if your starting chain is too tight to work into make a new one with a bigger hook turn to work into the other side of the starting chain single_crochet to the end of the row single_crochet into the stitch with the marker remove the marker then single_crochet all the way around test your work so far on the bag if it fits just keep crocheting until the liner bag is nearly covered if not start over with a longer or shorter starting chain when you get about 2 rounds from the top at one of the ends check to see if you have an even number of stitches if not either single_crochet twice in one stitch or decrease whichever fits your bag best for the last round work a picot border *single_crochet chain 2 insert hook down through the front loop of the single_crochet you just made yarn over pull that loop through both loops on the hook single_crochet in next stitch* in the very last stitch slip_stitch instead of single_crochet sew the liner bag into the crochet shell a running stitch weaving in and out of the zipper s edge and back of the picot stitches is all it needs you re finished already well done if you have any questions comments or want to show me a finished object please send a message through ravelry or email me at jenniferdcknsn@gmail com you can also find me on instagram as jen_dickinson_ thanks for choosing my pattern i hope you enjoyed it
